org.pikater.shared.quartz

Class MyJobScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pikater.shared.PropertiesHandler
      • org.pikater.shared.quartz.MyJobScheduler

  • public class MyJobScheduler
extends PropertiesHandler
    A custom implementation of a job/task scheduler based on Scheduler, providing some convenience interface.
    Author:
    SkyCrawl

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MyJobScheduler(java.lang.String quartzConfAbsPath)
      By default, StdSchedulerFactory loads a ".properties" configuration file named "quartz.properties" from the 'current working directory'.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MyJobScheduler

        public MyJobScheduler(java.lang.String quartzConfAbsPath)
        By default, StdSchedulerFactory loads a ".properties" configuration file named "quartz.properties" from the 'current working directory'. If that fails, the "quartz.properties" file located (as a resource) in the "org.quartz" package is loaded and that is what we are providing.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
           throws org.quartz.SchedulerException
        Start the scheduler. No jobs are defined after this call.
        Throws:
        org.quartz.SchedulerException

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
              throws org.quartz.SchedulerException
        Shuts down the scheduler. All defined jobs are lost.
        Throws:
        org.quartz.SchedulerException

      • defineJob

        public org.quartz.JobKey defineJob(java.lang.Class<? extends ZeroArgJob> clazz)
                            throws java.lang.Exception

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setArguments

        protected static void setArguments(org.quartz.JobDetail detail,
                AbstractJobWithArgs helperJobInstance,
                java.lang.Object[] args)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets arguments to a job defined by the arguments. This method should be used prior to scheduling the job.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
